proTips: This dressing will keep for one week in a sealed container and is great for use on salads or as a sauce on meats such as chicken or steak.

directions: With a food processor running, add garlic and let processor run to mince.
Turn off processor, scrape the sides of the bowl and add the remaining ingredients to the bowl.
Run the food processor to combine until creamy.

proTips: This salsa is very versatile and can be served with chips, or used as a sauce over meat, or other prepared dinner entree dishes.

items.item: Ripe Avocado, cut in half and pitted

directions: Place ingredients in a food processor bowl. Attach cover to the bowl and lock it into place.
Blend ingredients on high until pureed.
Remove the salsa from the food processor and pour into a serving bowl.

proTips: This salsa pairs very well with pulled pork, beef, or chicken.

items.item: Tart Cherries, dried and chopped medium
Lime zest and juice to add into salsa

directions: In a medium saucepan, add the juice, brown sugar, jelly and chopped dried tart cherries.
Heat contents to medium to high heat and watch carefully, stirring occasionally to melt and meld together.
Lower heat and simmer on medium for about 20 minutes.
Remove pan from heat.
Add remaining ingredients.
If the salsa is too runny, place back on medium to high heat and cook for about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. As the sauce cools, it will gel and thicken.
Add the chopped cilantro.
Taste for seasoning and add salt and pepper if needed.

proTips: This sauce is very versatile and can be paired with meats like chicken, pork or shrimp, and it can be used for vegetable and rice dishes for a vegetarian option.
Try adding more or less of the curry powder or chili garlic sauce to try different dimensions of this sauce.

directions: Place ingredients in a bowl and mix thoroughly to combine. Chill in the refrigerator.

proTips: This sauce pairs well with beef tenderloin or shrimp cocktail.

directions: Place ingredients in a bowl and mix thoroughly to combine. Chill in the refrigerator.

proTips: This ice cream is excellent served with apples and fruit for a nice fall Dessert.

ingredients.section: Cinnamon Creme Fraiche Ice Cream Ingredients

instructions.recipeSection: Preparing Cinnamon Creme Fraiche Ice Cream
directions: Place all ingredients in a bowl and whisk together until the liquid is smooth.
Pour mixture into ice cream machine, or use a KitchenAidÂ® ice cream mixer bowl attachment.
Set the machine to churn for about 30 minutes or until the mixture is creamy and thick.
Chill for about an hour in the freezer. Stir the mixture before serving.
NOTE: this ice cream is meant to be consumed the same day it is made.
Cook spiral noodles in salted water according to package directions.
When cooked, drain and do not rinse the pasta. Set cooked pasta aside.
Place a large, 12-inch saute pan on cooktop's largest burner. Turn burner on high to heat the pan. Add olive oil to hot pan to lightly coat the bottom.
Add the onions and cook for 3 minutes until the onions are transparent.
Add the chorizo and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring to break up and mix with the onions.
Add the garlic and cook for about 2 minutes, lowering the flame to medium if the pan is too hot.
Keeping the pan on the flame, add the cooked and drained spiral noodles to the pan with the chorizo and onion mixture.
Stir to coat the spiral noodles. Turn the heat up to medium to high heat and season with salt and pepper.
Add 2 eggs at a time to the pasta mixture, stir vigorously to scramble, and combine the eggs with the pasta. Continue to add eggs until they are all combined in the pasta.
Once all the eggs are in the mixture and cooking, add the gruyere, gouda, and goat cheeses, stirring to let the cheeses melt.
Taste for seasoning and add the hot pepper flakes.

proTips: Add mint as a fresh garnish to this amazing treat.

ingredients.section: Raspberry Creme Fraiche Ice Cream Ingredients

instructions.recipeSection: Preparing Raspberry Creme Fraiche Ice Cream
directions: Place all ingredients (except raspberries) in a bowl and whisk together.
Pour mixture into ice cream machine, or use a KitchenAidÂ® ice cream mixer bowl attachment.
Add raspberries and set the machine to churn for about 30 minutes or until the mixture is creamy and thick.
Chill for about an hour in the freezer. Stir the mixture before serving.
NOTE: this ice cream is meant to be consumed the same day it is made.

proTips: Use your JennAirÂ® refrigerator's max cool mode to lower temperatures to help cool your Creme Anglaise.
This sauce is a versatile dessert custard sauce that is perfect over fruit, or shortcake... or both!

directions: Fill a large bowl with ice. Place the whipping cream and the vanilla bean paste into a large saucepan. Heat on medium to high heat.
When small bubbles form around the pan's edge, the cream is ready.
While the cream is heating, place the egg yolks in a medium-sized bowl atop a small, damp towel on the countertop. The towel will keep the bowl from moving while you are whisking ingredients.
Whisk egg yolks and pour sugar over the yolks while whisking vigorously. Whisk until eggs are pale yellow in color.

When the cream is heated, slowly add 2 tablespoons of heated cream to the yolk and sugar mixture and stir quickly. Add the hot cream slowly to prevent scrambling the yolk - this method is called tempering.
Continue to slowly add the heated cream until half remains. Then, pour the yolk and sugar mixture into the pan with the remaining cream, and return the pan to the cooktop to heat.
Heat mixture on medium heat and stir constantly with a wooden spoon until the mixture thickens and coats the back of the spoon. Do not overcook or the eggs will curdle.
When creme anglaise has thickened, transfer the pan and place atop the bowl with ice. Stir the creme anglaise in the pan until it has cooled.
Pour into a glass bowl and place plastic wrap directly on top of the creme anglaise.
Place in the refrigerator until ready to use. Sauce will keep for three days.

proTips: Make extra Cilantro Lime Puree sauce to put over chicken, or to use as a salad dressing.

directions: Place the ingredients in a 2-quart sauce pan and bring rice and liquid to a boil.
Immediately lower heat to simmer and let cook for 20 minutes covered at medium to low heat.
Place ingredients in a food processor bowl and blend on high until mixture turns into a puree.
Place pureed mixture in a bowl and set aside at room temperature to add to cooked rice.
When rice has finished cooking, remove the pan from the heat.
Toss rice with fork and add the cilantro lime puree.
Stir to mix thoroughly.
Place prepared rice in a serving bowl to serve immediately. Garnish with chopped cilantro.

customRecipes.recipeTitle: Wild Rice with Butternut Squash & Dried Cherries

items.item: Red Onion, cut in half then in thin slices

directions: Start cooking rice before prepping squash.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit on Convection Roast mode.
Place all of the ingredients for wild rice in a medium saucepan and place pan on cooktop on high heat.
Bring to a boil and then immediately turn down heat to a simmer.
Simmer the rice for about 45 minutes until kernels have popped, the stock has been absorbed and the rice is tender. Be careful not to burn the rice on the bottom of the pan.
Remove from heat and keep the lid on the pan until ready to combine the rice with the butternut squash mixture.
Place the butternut squash in a bowl with the onions and mushrooms.
Sprinkle olive oil over the ingredients and season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine.
Line 2 sheet trays with foil and spray with vegetable spray.
Line the cut butternut squash, mushrooms and onions evenly on the tray in a single layer.
Place the tray in the oven and cook for 20 minutes.
Remove and check for doneness. They will be soft to an inserted fork.
When they are soft, pour the maple syrup on the squash, mushrooms and onions and stir to cover evenly. Place the tray back in the oven for about 10-15 minutes until caramelized.
Mix all the dry ingredients into the syrup and thoroughly stir to mix. Set aside.

instructions.recipeSection: Assembling the Rice and Squash Mixture
directions: When the squash is cooked, remove from the oven and pour contents into a large bowl.
Place the cooked wild rice into the bowl with the squash mixture.
Add dried cherries to the wild rice and squash mixture, folding the ingredients together to combine completely.
Pour the maple syrup combination over the mixture and stir to cover the ingredients. Taste for seasoning and serve.

items.item: Red Pepper, roasted and chopped small
Green Onions, sliced thin and minced
Pepper Cheese, shredded (half in egg mix and half for top)

instructions.recipeSection: Preparing the Ham and Egg Casserole
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit on Convection Bake mode.
Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with vegetable spray.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, half-and-half, and salt and pepper.
Add ham, red pepper, green onions and half the pepper cheese to the egg mixture.
Place on a center rack and cook for 1 hour.

proTips: This recipe is best prepared in a JennAirÂ® Steam Oven.

directions: In a medium saucepan, scale the cream until bubbles form around the pan's edge. Remove the pan from heat.
In a medium bowl, whisk the egg yolks together and pour in the sugar while whisking quickly. Continous whisking is essential.
Slowly add the hot cream to the sugar / egg mixture a few tablespoons at a time. Whisk together. Do not add the hot mixture to the eggs all at once or the heat will curdle the eggs.
Add the vanilla bean paste to the creme and stir to combine. Pour into a medium pitcher or glass measuring cup so that it may be easily divided up among the 12 ramekins.
Fill about 1/2-inch from the top of each dish.
Place ramekins on the wire roasting rack in the center of the oven. Cook for 25 minutes in steam mode. When cooked, remove from the oven and let cool or refrigerate.
Sprinkle a small amount of sugar on top of the creme brulee.
Using a small kitchen torch, direct flame on top of the custard to melt the sugar. Avoid getting too close or the sugar will burn. Strive for a golden brown color on the sugar.

customRecipes.cookingTime: 1 hour 20 minutes plus 15 minutes rest time

instructions.recipeSection: Preparing the Lemon Thyme Roasted Chicken
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit on Convection Bake mode, or select and use the Poultry mode, Chicken Roaster pre-set cycle button located below, until the meat registers at least 165 degrees with a meat probe.
Place the roasting chicken breast side down. Place fingers underneath the skin starting at the top and move them back and forth to create a cavity. Repeat on both sides of the chicken breast.
Place the sliced lemon and thyme in a single layer in these cavities . You should be able to get 4 lemon slices on each side.
Generously salt and pepper all sides of the prepared chicken.
Place on a sheet tray in the oven on the middle rack. The chickens will cook for 1 hour and 20 minutes to perfection.
Remove from oven when cooked and let rest for 15 minutes. Cut chicken into desired service pieces and place on a platter.

proTips: Bacon or sausage can be added to this dish to create the perfect breakfast casserole.

directions: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with vegetable spray
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit on Convection Bake mode, or select and use the Casserole mode, Sweet Potato Casserole preset cycle button located below.
Mix sweet potatoes, potatoes and green onion in a large mixing bowl.
Pour the sour cream mixture over this mixture and stir until the sauce is completely mixed in.
Transfer to a casserole dish.
Mix together in a separate bowl.
Sprinkle evenly over the top of the sweet potato and potato mixture in a casserole dish.
Place on center rack of the oven and cook for approximately 25 minutes.

proTips: This dessert is best served with vanilla ice cream.

items.item: Honeycrisp Apples, peeled, cored and cut into 1/4 inch slices
Lemon Juice, tossed on the peeled apples

directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit on Convection Bake mode.
Lightly spray 6, 8-ounce ramekins with vegetable spray.
After lemon is tossed on the apples, toss apples and blackberries to mix completely. Set bowl aside.
Mix remaining ingredients in a separate bowl and pour over the lemon-tossed, sliced apples and blackberries. Toss to combine.
Cover with sugar mixture.
Mix the dry ingredients together and then pour the melted butter into the mixture.
Stir to combine until it resembles small crumbles.
Sprinkle evenly on top of the sugared apples/blackberries in the ramekins.
Place the ramekins on a sheet tray and bake for about 20-30 minutes or until golden brown on top (and mixture is bubbling).
Remove the ramekins from the oven and let cool.

proTips: Serve with vanilla ice cream, raspberry sauce and mint leaf to amp up this recipe.
Use Gluten Free All-Purpose Flour to make this a gluten free recipe.

directions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit on Convection Bake mode.
Butter four, 4-ounce molds, custard cups or ramekins with softened butter or spray.
Dust each mold with cocoa powder and tap out the excess.
Place prepared dishes on a baking sheet.
Put chocolate and unsalted butter into a small saucepan and place on the cooktop's melting feature.
Once chocolate is melted, remove pan from cooktop and stir in espresso powder.
Let the chocolate mixture cool for a few minutes.
Beat the eggs and egg yolks together in a mixing bowl with wire whisk.
Add sugar and continue to whisk rapidly until mixture is thick and pale yellow.
Add the beaten egg mixture to the chocolate and stir to combine. Do not over mix.
Stir in the flour and pour batter into a liquid measuring glass to easily pour batter into ramekins.
Divide the batter between prepared molds and fill to about 3/4 full.
Place tray in oven and bake for 7 to 8 minutes. The top of the cake will have little cracks in it, and the center will be very soft and sink a bit. Do not over bake.
Watch carefully to see whether more time is needed.
When the cakes are cooked, let cool for a couple of minutes. Using a hot pad, invert ramekins or molds onto four individual dessert plates and let rest for 1 minute.
List ramekin or mold to release cake and let sit for a few minutes.
Dust cakes with powdered sugar.

items.item: Golden Flaxseed, ground and added to 6 tsp. of water
Coconut Oil, room temperature and melted

instructions.recipeSection: Preparing the Lemon Poppy Seed Bread
directions: Utilize the Bread mode or preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit on Convection Bake mode.
Spray a 9x5-inch bread pan with vegetable spray.
In a large bowl, sift together dry ingredients.
In a separate bowl, whisk the flaxseed, lemon zest, lemon juice, coconut milk and coconut oil together.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients and fold the mixture together until the dry ingredients are moist.

instructions.recipeSection: Completing the Lemon Poppy Seed Bread
directions: Place batter in bread pan.
Sprinkle top of batter with sparkling sugar.
Bake bread for about 50-60 minutes in convection oven.
Test doneness with a wooden skewer. If the skewer comes out clean, the bread is done.
If not, place the pan in the oven for another 10 minutes and test again.
Cool in the pan about 10 minutes and then remove the bread from the pan and transfer to a cooling rack.
Let the bread cool before cutting.

customRecipes.recipeTitle: Steamed Green Beans with Balsamic Dressing
proTips: This recipe uses a JennAirÂ® Steam Oven. This can also be created utilizing a steam dish in the microwave, or steamer on the rangetop.

directions: Whisk vinegar, lemon juice, honey, and dijon mustard together.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Slowly pour garlic olive oil and whisk to incorporate into mixture.
Set aside for later.
Place prepared green beans in a large bowl.
Drizzle garlic olive oil lightly over the green beans and toss to cover.
Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer beans to the steam oven perforated tray and place on the center rack of a JennAirÂ® Steam Oven. Follow the vegetables settings on the steam oven in the preset foods mode.

instructions.recipeSection: Serving Green Beans with Balsamic Dressing
directions: When green beans are cooked, place them in a large bowl and toss a small amount of the dressing to lightly cover.
Sprinkle sliced almonds on top and serve.

customRecipes.recipeTitle: Roasted Vegetables with Butter Lime Sauce
proTips: Consider roasting the vegetables in the oven using the roasted vegetables mode.

items.item: Red Pepper, seeded and chopped small
Cherry or Grape Tomatoes, sliced in half

directions: In a small saute pan, melt the butter on low heat. When the butter is melted, remove from heat.
Add limes, cilantro, mint and cayenne pepper to the pan with melted butter. Stir to combine.
Cook the baby red potatoes in boiling water for about 10 minutes. Remove from water and let set to cool for 10 minutes before quartering them.
Place a large saute pan on medium heat. Add olive oil to thinly coat the pan's bottom.
Lightly season the vegetables as you add each to the pan.
Place the quartered potatoes in the pan and season with salt and pepper.
Cook for 4 minutes and add the corn to the pan. Stir to combine.
Cook for 5 minutes and add the red pepper and red onion.
Cook for 1 minute and add the garlic.
Add tomatoes last and cook for another 3 minutes.
Remove pan from heat and place the vegetables in a serving bowl. Toss Butter Lime sauce on the vegetables before serving.
Cover 2 sheet trays with foil.
Place whole stems of asparagus in a bowl and drizzle with olive oil. Salt and pepper to season.
Lay the asparagus in a single layer on the foiled sheet tray.
Place the tray in oven and cook for about 10 minutes in Roasted Vegetables mode until tender, but not mushy.
Remove asparagus from trays and place in bowl. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of lemon juice on roasted asparagus and toss.
Place asparagus on platter with tips facing the same way, and serve immediately.

proTips: This dish can be served as a side dish as well as a breakfast main entree. Add bacon and garnish with green onion.

items.item: Thawed Hash Browns or Fresh Grated Potato

directions: Spray 9x13-inch baking dish with vegetable spray.
Mix together potatoes and onions in a large bowl.
Pour sour cream mixture over the hashbrowns and onions. Stir until completely incorporated and pour into baking dish.
Sprinkle topping mixture evenly over the potatoes.

Bake in a JennAirÂ® oven with convection on 350 degrees Fahrenheit in Convection Bake mode for 35-45 minutes, or use with a JennAirÂ® speedcook microwave, selecting fresh-made casseroles for 25 minutes (glass dish only in speedcook mode).

proTips: Consider using Convect Pastry mode which uses upper, lower and convection elements to create exceptionally flaky crusts.

items.item: Madeira Wine, or your favorite dry red wine
Water, whisk water and egg together

directions: Heat a large skillet on medium high heat.
Heat butter and olive oil in skillet until butter is melted.
Add the shallots and let cook until transparent, about 1 minute.
Season with salt and pepper.
Place the mushrooms in the pan and stir until covered with the butter / oil combination.
Continue to heat until the mushrooms cook down, about 2 minutes.
Stir in the garlic, thyme and nutmeg.
Cook an additional 1 minute.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add the asparagus to the mushroom mixture.
Add the wine to the mushroom mixture and cook until all the liquid is absorbed, about 3 minutes.
Remove the pan from heat and place cooked mixture on a parchment lined sheet tray to cool ingredients to room temperature.
NOTE: May place in the refrigerator to cool faster.
Place the puff pastry dough on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Place the cooled mixture in the middle of the puff pastry about 3-inches wide, going down vertically from top to bottom.
The mixture will be about 1-inch high. Leave a 2-inch space of dough at the top and the bottom so you can fold the pastry in.
Sprinkle Gruyere cheese on top of the mushroom mixture.
At the top of the pastry, cut off the corners of the pastry at an angle.
On each side of the mushroom mixture there should be about 4-inches of dough.

On the left side starting from the top, take a knife and cut the dough at an angle to form one inch strips all the way to the bottom. Each slit is about 4-inches long. Repeat the same process on the right side of the pastry sheet.

Starting from the top of the pastry, fold the top down and then take one strip on the left side and bring it over the top of the mixture to the right side. Then repeat on the right side. Continue repeating on each side, braiding the strips across the top and enclosing the mixture into the pastry.
Before you get to the bottom, ensure both ends are folded up underneath the braid, tucking remaining dough under the strudel and fully enclosing the mixture.
Brush the entire top of the pastry dough with the egg and water wash. This will give it a shiny glaze while it is baking.
NOTE: You can also add course sea salt to the top of the pastry dough.
Place in a preheated oven for about 30 minutes on Convection Pastry or Convection Bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit until the pastry is golden brown.
Cut into 2-inch slices or smaller for an appetizer or side dish. Serve immediately.

proTips: You won't use all of the pecan mixture, so keep the leftovers in a ziplock bag and store in the freezer to use as needed at a later date.

items.item: Cayenne Pepper (use more or less according to your taste)

directions: Preheat a JennAirÂ® wall oven with V2 dual-fan convection system to 350 degrees Fahrenheit on Convection Bake mode.
Place all ingredients for coating in a food processor and blend to combine until the pecans are crushed and ingredients are pulverized.
Wrap a sheet tray with aluminum foil.
Line the bacon on the tray (you may need 2 trays).
Place the bacon in the oven for about 17 minutes or until bacon is almost cooked.
Remove the bacon from the oven and sprinkle a thin layer of the praline mixture on top of the bacon to cover it completely. Don't put it on too thick.
Place the trays back in the oven and bake until the bacon is golden brown, taking care not to burn.
Remove bacon from oven and place on a paper towel to soak up some of the oil. Don't blot the top of the bacon, or it will remove the coating.
Transfer from the paper towel to a serving platter. Serve immediately.

proTips: This recipe works well with a skillet, but it is a great recipe for a built-in JennAir Chrome Infused Griddle.
A food processor or blender can make short work of Zesty Salsa preparation. Be sure to follow directions for using a pulse option to ensure a fine chopped result.

Crepes can be pre-made to warm later and combine with a favorite filling. As you finish crepes, stack them between sheets of waxed paper to prevent them from sticking. Wrap the stacked crepes in plastic wrap. They will keep for days.

items.item: Jalapeno Peppers, seeded and chopped small

directions: If using a non-stick skillet, heat the heavy skillet until hot.
If using a griddle, preheat the griddle to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
Add the potatoes to pan and cook for 15 minutes.
Add the onions and the red pepper and cook about 5 minutes on medium to high heat and season with salt and pepper as sauteing.
While the potato mixture is sauteing, place the chorizo in a medium size saute pan and cook on medium to high heat.
As the chorizo cooks, break up the meat into small pieces.
After cooking for about 10 minutes, add the cooked chorizo to the potato mixture and stir to combine.
Cook all the ingredients together until the potatoes are tender.
NOTE: This mixture will be placed in the cooked crepe that has been topped with pepper cheese.
Combine all the ingredients and chill for one hour in the refrigerator.
Combine the flour, sugar and salt in a bowl with a wire whisk.
In another bowl, combine the eggs and milk and whisk to mix.
Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture and whisk until smooth, pouring melted butter in until incorporated.
Ensure cooking surface (non-stick skillet or griddle) is hot.

Pour 3 tablespoons of the batter with a ladle, then place the ladle lightly on top of the batter and swirl in a circle starting from the inside slowly moving to the outside. This will help thin the crepe.
Turn the crepe over when the batter goes from shiny to matte. Flip the crepe and cook another minute.
Sprinkle shredded pepper cheese on the cooked, flipped crepe and then place about 2 tablespoons of potato and chorizo filling on top of the cheese on one half of the crepe.
Fold the other half of the crepe over the filling and remove from griddle with spatula.
Place on a plate and garnish with the salsa and onions. Serve immediately.

proTips: This bread goes really well with chive butter or chive oil.
Use gluten free all-purpose flour to make this a gluten free bread.

items.item: Vegetable Oil (do not use olive oil)

instructions.recipeSection: Preparing the Garlic Onion Quick Bread
directions: Utilize the Bread cycle or preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit on Convection Bake mode.
In a large bowl, sift together the dry ingredients.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, buttermilk and oil.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and fold the mixture until the dry ingredients are moist. Do not over mix.

instructions.recipeSection: Completing the Garlic Onion Quick Bread
directions: Pour batter into the prepared bread pan and bake for about 50 minutes to 1-hour.
Test doneness with a wooden skewer. If the skewer comes out clean, the bread is done.
If not, place the pan in the oven for another 10 minutes and test again.
Cool in pan about 10 minutes. Then, remove the bread from the pan and transfer to a cooling rack.

proTips: Serve with fresh, seasonal fruit.
Use gluten free all-purpose flour to make this a gluten free bread.

items.item: Vegetable Oil (do not use olive oil)

directions: Utilize the Bread mode or preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit on Convection Bake mode.
Spray a 9x5-inch pan with vegetable spray.
In a large bowl, sift together the dry ingredients (flour through salt) and then add the frozen blueberries. Toss to combine and cover.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, orange zest, buttermilk and oil.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and fold the mixture together until the dry ingredients are moist. Do not over mix.

instructions.recipeSection: Completing the Blueberry Orange Breakfast Bread
directions: Pour the batter into the prepared bread pan and bake for about 1 hour.
Test doneness with a wooden skewer. If the skewer comes out clean, the bread is done.
If not, place the pan in the oven for another 10 minutes and test again.
Cool in pan for about 10 minutes, then remove bread from the pan and transfer to a cooling rack.
Thoroughly mix together ingredients for Vanilla Bean Honey Butter until creamy. Serve with bread.

proTips: Roasted garlic butter goes really well with this bread.
Use gluten free all-purpose flour to make this a gluten free bread.

items.item: Vegetable Oil (do not use olive oil)

directions: Utilize the Bread mode or preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit on Convection Bake mode.
Spray a 9x5-inch pan with vegetable spray.
In a large bowl, sift together the dry ingredients.
In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs, buttermilk and oil together.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and fold the mixture together until the dry ingredients are moist. Do not over mix.
Pour batter into the prepared bread pan and bake for about 1 hour.
Test doneness with a wooden skewer. If the skewer comes out clean, the bread is done.
If not, place the pan in the oven for another 10 minutes and test again.
Cool in the pan about 10 minutes and then remove the bread from the pan to transfer to a cooling rack.

customRecipes.recipeTitle: Green Onion Corn Cakes with Dill Creme Fraiche
proTips: This recipe works well with a skillet, but it is a great recipe for a built-in JennAir Chrome Infused Griddle.
Watch your cook times so that the corn cakes do not dry out.

directions: If using a non-stick skillet, heat the heavy skillet until hot.
If using a griddle, preheat the griddle to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
Mix cornmeal, flour, salt, baking powder, cayenne and green onions together in a medium bowl.
Whisk the egg, milk and butter together.
Add the wet mixture to the dry and stir to combine.
Stir the corn and mix to combine the batter.
Scoop 1 tablespoon of the batter onto the heated pan or griddle. The cake size should be about 2" in diameter.
Cook corn cake until bubbles appear, then flip the cake over and cook for about 2 additional minutes.
Place ingredients in a food processor and pulse until combined.
Place mixture into a squeeze bottle.
NOTE: Dill creme fraiche will keep in refrigerator for one week.
Serve on top of Green Onion Corn Cakes.

proTips: This recipe can be prepared in a standard JennAir V2 Convection Oven, or in a JennAir Steam Convection Oven. Cooking with steam and convection is a quick and gentle way to prepare items like delicate seafood.

items.item: Kosher Salt and Ground Black Pepper
Kosher Salt and Ground Black Pepper

directions: Place salmon in baking dish and season with salt and pepper.
Position in the Oven on a center rack.
Follow on screen or in app instructions for seafood, salmon/tuna steak or whole fish (steam oven).
Mix together all ingredients for the mayo dill sauce.
Remove Salmon from the oven and let rest for about 3 minutes before serving.
Salmon should be opaque in the middle. If you prefer your salmon more done, add 2 minutes to the cook time.
Place cooked salmon on a serving platter with lemons as a garnish.
Spread a thin layer of mayo dill sauce on top of the cooked salmon. Or, serve on the side.
Serve immediately.

proTips: Optional - for sweeter crepes, omit cumin and add 1 tablespoon sugar and 2 tablespoons of smoked paprika.

Crepes can be pre-made to warm later and combine with a favorite filling. As you finish crepes, stack them between sheets of waxed paper to prevent them from sticking. Wrap the stacked crepes in plastic wrap. They will keep for days.
This recipe works well with a skillet, but it is a great recipe for a built-in JennAir Chrome Infused Griddle.

items.item: Shredded Cheese (pepper jack or fresh mexican queso)
Season to taste with salt and pepper

directions: Combine the flour, cumin (or alt cumin for sugar and smoked paprika for a sweeter crepe) and salt in a bowl with a wire whisk.
In another bowl, combine the milk and eggs; whisk to mix.
Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture and whisk until smooth. Pour in the melted butter and whisk until incorporated.
NOTE: Make sure the butter is room temperature before adding to batter. Do not pour hot butter into the batter.
NOTE: Always make the batter the day you make the crepes and cook with a few hours.

instructions.recipeSection: Making the Black Bean Filling (cook this first)
directions: Heat a large skillet on Medium High. Add a thick layer of olive oil to the heated pan.
Add the onions and cook about 1 minute.
Add peppers, black beans and corn and cook for another 3 minutes.
NOTE: Season as you cook with salt and pepper.
Heat on warm until ready to fill the crepes.
If using a non-stick skillet, heat the heavy skillet until hot.
If using a griddle, preheat the griddle to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.

Pour about 3 tablespoons of the batter from a ladle onto the griddle and then place the ladle lightly on top of batter and swirl in a circle starting from the inside slowly moving to the outside. This will help thin the crepe.
Turn the crepe over when the batter goes from shiny to matte. Flip the crepe and cook another minute.

instructions.recipeSection: Filling Crepes with Black Bean Mixture
directions: Sprinkle some of the cheese on the cooked, flipped crepe and then place about 2 tablespoons of black bean/pepper filling on top of the cheese in the middle of the crepe.
Fold half of the crepe over the filling and then the other half toward middle.
Remove from griddle or pan with spatula.
Place on a plate and garnish or serve with salsa.

proTips: Try offering not only with standard sides, but with a variety of salsas such as a tomatillo salsa or pineapple salsa to offer guests the ability to customize their experience.
This recipe works well with a skillet, but it is a great recipe for a built-in JennAir Chrome Infused Griddle.

items.item: Black Beans, cooked, or canned; drained

instructions.recipeSection: Preparing the Black Bean Corn Cakes
directions: Place the beans in a large bowl and mash them with a fork. Smash the beans so they are roughly mashed and you still see the bean - don't overdo it!
Add the sweet potato, onion, garlic, jalapenos, corn and egg.
Mix together the rice flour, cumin, smoked paprika, ground clove, salt and pepper.
Pour the spice mixture into the bean mixture and stir with hands or spoon to combine.
Roll beans into the size of a small baseball and then flatten. Press the edges of the cake to smooth out.

instructions.recipeSection: Cooking the Black Bean Corn Cakes
directions: Heat a large saute pan or JennAir Chrome Infused Griddle to medium heat.
Add a thin layer of olive oil to the pan; JennAir Chrome Griddles do not require oil.
Place the formed bean cakes in the pan or on the griddle, and cook each side until golden brown. About 4 minutes each.
Serve immediately with salsa.

proTips: Squeeze out extra oil from the sun-dried tomatoes and chop small to amp up flavors.

items.item: Crumbled Feta Cheese (1/2 for egg mix and 1/2 for top)

directions: Spray a 13x9-inch casserole dish with vegetable spray.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit with Convection Bake.
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, half-and-half, oregano, salt and pepper.
Stir in the arugula, mushrooms, 1 cup of the feta cheese and sun-dried tomatoes.
Pour mixture into prepared baking dish and top with remaining cup of the feta cheese.
Cook for about 30-40 minutes until puffy and no longer watery in the middle.

proTips: Pro-Tip: Adding fresh herbs can bring out new flavors in the lamb. Try roasting with fresh sprigs of Rosemary, or Thyme.

directions: "French" the Rack of Lamb by removing the meat from the top of the bones.
Pro-Tip: Ask your butcher to "French" the lamb ahead of time.
Roll the Rack of Lamb so the two ends come together with the fatty side on the inside. The bones should be pointed upward to look like a fountain of water.
Using butcher twine, wrap the meat so it remains in place while cooking in the oven.
Rub garlic oil generously around the sides and bottom.
Generously season the sides with salt and pepper.
Place prepared lamb on a sheet tray fitted with a meat rack.
Tap the button below to walk through oven settings for Rack of Lamb.

proTips: Do not marinate for more than an hour as the meat becomes mealy from the acid in the lime juice. Once you are done marinating the meat, discard the marinade and do not reuse.

items.item: Medium white onion peeled, stem removed and quartered

directions: Blend all of the ingredients in a food processor or blender.
Marinate the steaks for 30-60 minutes.
Remove the steaks and brush off excess marinade.
Season generously with kosher salt and ground pepper.
Grill or sear each side, then place in the oven to roast to medium rare using your oven's meat probe.
Tenderly slice the steaks and serve garnished with fresh cilantro and sliced lime as a main entree.

proTips: Adding fresh herbs versus dry can bring out an even stronger flavor. Try using fresh oregano, cracked pepper and salt, and garlic to amp up flavor intensity. A mort and pestle can further break down the herb mixture and intensify flavors.
Using fresh, colorful accompaniments makes your food presentation really pop for your guests.

directions: Add spices to a bowl and whisk together to mix thoroughly. When spices are mixed, sprinkle half the spice rub on a sheet tray.
Roll each pork tenderloin in the spice and place on a sheet tray lined with a meat rack. Add additional spice if needed.
Heat a large saute pan on medium high heat.
Add a thick layer of olive oil to cover the bottom of the pan.
Place tenderloins in the pan, and sear each side until brown and caramelized.
This process should take no longer than 5 minutes. Remember to sear the meat quickly to lock in natural juices.
Remove the pan from heat and place seared tenderloins back on the meat rack lined sheet tray.
Pour fresh lime juice onto the pork and toss to cover completely.
Serve with fresh produce such as cabbage, lettuce, and tomatoes. Salsa, and corn or flour tortillas warmed on the side with cheese are also a perfect accompaniment.
Tap the button below to walk through oven settings for pork tenderloin.

proTips: Let the salmon rest for 3 minutes before serving.

directions: Place salmon in baking tray.
Position in center rack of the oven.
Mix ingredients together in a bowl and set aside for assembly.
Remove Salmon from oven and let rest for about 3 minutes before serving.
Place cooked Salmon on a serving platter with lemons as a garnish. Spread a layer of maple mustard sauce on top of the cooked salmon.
Sprinkle with minced chives.
Tap the button below to walk through oven settings for salmon.

proTips: Watch the quality of your ingredients. Selecting organic ketchup with no sugar added, quality olive oil and real maple syrup will enhance the flavors of your sauce.
Tip: Using fresh, colorful accompaniments makes your food presentation really pop for your guests.

items.item: Roasting Chicken, Quartered or Boneless if preferred

directions: Place barbecue sauce ingredients in one bowl and whisk together to combine.
Place chicken on a preheated medium high griddle, grill or pan.
Cook each side for 5 minutes, turning the chicken only once.
Remove chicken and place in a 13x9 baking dish.
Tuck cut onions in around the top of the chicken.
Sprinkle salt and pepper on top to taste.
Pour the blended barbecue sauce evenly over the chicken.
Tap the button below to walk through oven settings for chicken.

proTips: Adding fresh herbs versus dry can bring out an even stronger flavor. Try using fresh oregano, cracked pepper, salt, and garlic to amp up flavor intensity. A mort and pestle can further break down the herb mixture and intensify flavors.

directions: Add spices to a bowl and whisk together to mix thoroughly. When spices are mixed, sprinkle half the spice rub on a sheet tray.
Roll each pork tenderloin in the spice and place on a sheet tray lined with a meat rack. Add additional spice if needed.
Heat a large saute pan on medium high heat.
Add a thick layer of olive oil to cover the bottom of the pan.
Place tenderloins in the pan, and sear each side until brown and caramelized.
This process should take no longer than 5 minutes. Remember to sear the meat quickly to lock in natural juices.
Remove the pan from heat and place seared tenderloins back on the meat rack lined sheet tray.
Pour fresh lime juice onto the pork and toss to cover completely.
Serve with fresh produce such as cabbage, lettuce, and tomatoes. Salsa, and corn or flour tortillas warmed on the side with cheese are also a perfect accompaniment.
